did.abstract: The collection contains a significant amount of material pertaining to the Delaware and Hudson Railroad (D&H) where Harry E. Schultz, Jr. was employed as a civil engineer for more than 40 years.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of Delaware and Hudson Railroad (D&H) memos regarding operations and maintenance and clearance; photographs, including albums containing images of stations along the D&H Railroad lines - Saratoga Division (1913), Champlain Division (1914 and ca. 1925), Albany Improvements, Susquehanna Division (ca. 1925); slides; manuals and guides; postcards; maps; and D&H memorabilia.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Elizabeth Barry, daughter of Harry E. Schultz, Jr., donated all materials in this collection to the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives in 2021.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Harry E. Schultz, Jr. was born in 1922 in Albany, N.Y. and raised in nearby Colonie. He attended Union College. Schultz was employed by the Delaware & Hudson Railroad (D&H) as a civil engineer for 41 years. He rose from an entry level position in North Creek and retired in 1983 as assistant chief engineer of the company. During his career he was stationed in North Creek, Saratoga, Plattsburgh, and Albany. His work often required him to travel to Binghamton, Scranton, and Wilkes-Barre, Pa.

Following Schultz's retirement, he worked for several local contractors as a consultant engineer. He was a lifetime member of the American Railway Engineering Association.
Schultz passed away in July 2007 and was survived by his wife of 58 years, Ann M. Keon Schultz, four children, and seven grandchildren.
